About Me

I am a Software Engineering student at Al Ahliyya Amman University, currently in my first university year, with an early start in the software industry. My main focus is backend development and building systems that are clear, structured, and easy to maintain.

I trained and worked at SMT Group in the development department, where I gained practical experience beyond typical training. During this time, I developed strong technical foundations, improved my problem-solving skills, and gained exposure to project workflows, teamwork, and business-oriented thinking.

I am also interested in artificial intelligence and how it can be used to improve software development productivity and outcomes. Currently, I am working on leading Project Think, focusing on combining learning, technology, and real project execution.
